intro: Tarenaya rosea, commonly known as the pink spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tarenaya rosea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
